body:
The server never starts up for one reason or another. Whether the database has issues, creating an account has issues, or I just get 404s with broken CSS, the master branch for more than less a week has never worked on my local build.

The Readme is outdated, based on Discord discussions I've had, half the exports don't need to be set (not to mention they should be set dynamically in the code if not otherwise defined!) but I can't even get that far to fix it myself without running the base app.

There's no documentation on which accounts to use since apparently Signup has been broken for even longer, (although for future contributors, the answer is "Ruqqie":"Password"), and the only way to find that out is in the Discord.

I understand Ruqqus is constantly out there trying to ship new features, but at least let new people get onboard the project. I want to help out Ruqqus from a developer standpoint, but it's just too broken for me to even do that.

/rant
body_html:
The server never starts up for one reason or another. Whether the database has issues, creating an account has issues, or I just get 404s with broken CSS, the master branch for more than less a week has never worked on my local build.

There's no documentation on which accounts to use since apparently Signup has been broken for even longer, (although for future contributors, the answer is "Ruqqie":"Password"), and the only way to find that out is in the Discord.

I understand Ruqqus is constantly out there trying to ship new features, but at least let new people get onboard the project. I want to help out Ruqqus from a developer standpoint, but it's just too broken for me to even do that.

/rant
title: I want to contribute to the Ruqqus source code, but the master branch is always a mess.

body:
I took a look a couple of weeks ago but clearly things are moving way too fast at the moment in terms of features, and even the database schema was changing considerably.

I'm waiting it out myself. I don't judge because I'm aware of how boring is it to just feature-freeze and focus on docs, stability and cleaning up. But that's what needs to happen right now if they want more people contributing. Let's also keep in mind that the main dev has a day job and this is a side project, if I recall correctly.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

author.bio:
Jewish - Socialist - Ally 

Cool logos I designed -->
+cryptocurrency
+linux
+unofficialruqqusapp
author.bio_html:
Jewish - Socialist - Ally

Cool logos I designed --> +cryptocurrency +Linux +UnofficialRuqqusApp

body: As someone who's thrown hardware at the problem... Don't. Cloud hosting solutions cover so many things that you just wouldn't think of on hardware, and it also means other people can help out easier. Ddosing, rate limiting, backups, initial cost, scaling, all of those things are worth the pennies.
body_html: As someone who's thrown hardware at the problem... Don't. Cloud hosting solutions cover so many things that you just wouldn't think of on hardware, and it also means other people can help out easier. Ddosing, rate limiting, backups, initial cost, scaling, all of those things are worth the pennies.

body:
> and the only way to find that out is in the Discord.

That's a huge problem for other stuff too. Ruqqus relies on Discord waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay too much, and for some reason the admins get triggered if someone speaks up about it.
